definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
seat of government/government repository (archive)/official residence/mansion/presidential palace/(honorific) Your home/prefecture (from Tang to Qing times)

sentences.english: Some believe there are concerns among the central government as well.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为中央政府也存在这样的忧虑。

sentences.english: Third, the law or regulation needs to be faithfully implemented by the central government.
sentences.chinese: 第三，该法律或法规必须由中央政府忠实地推行。

sentences.english: The Central Government hereby expresses its satisfaction and appreciation for the remarkable achievements that you have made.
sentences.chinese: 中央政府对你们取得的显著政绩，表示满意和赞赏。

sentences.english: Count or remove the central government selections, can make holding that skin owes area and decline.
sentences.chinese: 中央政府的选点或迁移，能造皮该区域的盛与衰。

sentences.english: The solemn statement of the central government on this issue was featured in full in the newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 各报全文刊登了中央政府对这个问题的庄严声明。

sentences.english: During the Sui and Tang dynasties, the central government strengthened its rule over Xinjiang.
sentences.chinese: 隋唐时期，中央政府加强对新疆的统治。

sentences.english: The central government has decided to devolve authority on the regions.
sentences.chinese: 中央政府已决定将权力下放给地方。

sentences.english: The central government will begin collecting fees for waste disposal.
sentences.chinese: 中央政府计划征收垃圾处置税。

sentences.english: The survey was conducted after the Central Government announced its intention to interpret the Basic Law again.
sentences.chinese: 调查在中央政府宣布人大再次释法后进行。

sentences.english: The chief executive is pre-ordained by the central government.
sentences.chinese: 特首是由中央政府钦点。

sentences.english: We dare not oppose the central government.
sentences.chinese: 我们哪敢跟中央政府唱反调。

sentences.english: "The central government can only start schemes and give money, " Rebello said.
sentences.chinese: 雷贝罗说，“中央政府只能制订计划然后提供资金。

sentences.english: He believed the governments of the thirteen states should be second to the central government.
sentences.chinese: 他认为，十三个州的政府应隶属于中央政府。

sentences.english: The Government will give preferential policies to increase financial input to the western region.
sentences.chinese: 中央政府将给予优惠政策，增加对西部的财政投入。

sentences.english: The government is implementing policies to help low-income households cope with inflation.
sentences.chinese: 中央政府正采取措施使低收入家庭应对通货膨胀。

sentences.english: Central-government officials couldn't be reached for comment.
sentences.chinese: 记者未能联系到中央政府官员置评。

definition: centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
Central Bank of the Republic of China (Taiwan)
